**Title:** Indigenous Performance Measurement Services for Natural Resources Canada

**Reference Number:** CB-476-66569883

**Publication Date:** March 1, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** April 3, 2024, 2:00 PM (EST)

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering

**Procurement Category:** SRV

**Selection Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

**Contract Description:**

Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) requires Indigenous performance measurement specialist services to support strategic planning and policy renewal for Wah-ila-toos, a multi-departmental initiative that aims to reduce diesel usage in remote and rural Indigenous communities.

The contracted specialist will contribute to the development of a culturally responsive performance measurement framework for NRCan. The objective is to measure the impact of Wah-ila-toos on reducing diesel usage and promoting the transition to clean energy in Indigenous, remote, and rural communities.

**Services Requirements:**

The selected service provider will be responsible for:

1. Developing a culturally responsive performance measurement framework for NRCan
2. Conducting research and analysis to measure the impact of Wah-ila-toos
3. Providing recommendations to NRCan on performance measurement best practices
4. Supporting the development of a dashboard to track performance metrics

**Eligibility:**

Only ProServices Supply Arrangement Holders qualified for services under categories 9.13- Performance Measurement Services - One (1) Senior and 9.14 - Subject Matter Expert - One (1) Senior are eligible to participate.
